intro: Libanotis coreana, commonly known as Korean starflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to Korea. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its star-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm and features narrow, lanceolate leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
